pages.text: Alloys are created by mixing various materials.

pages.title: Copper
pages.text: Suitable materials for alloying with copper include: $(li)$(l:29_copper)Copper$()

pages.title: Tin
pages.text: Suitable materials for alloying with tin include: $(li)$(l:50_tin)Tin$()

pages.title: Iron
pages.text: Suitable materials for alloying with iron include: $(li)$(l:26_iron)Iron$() $(li)$(l:26_iron)Sponge Iron$()

pages.title: Carbon
pages.text: Suitable materials for alloying with carbon include: $(li)$(l:6_carbon)Coal$()

pages.title: Pure Carbon
pages.text: Suitable materials for alloying with pure carbon include: $(li)$(l:6_carbon)Coke$() $(li)$(l:6_carbon)Graphite$()

pages.title: Aluminum
pages.text: Suitable materials for alloying with aluminum include: $(li)$(l:13_aluminum)Aluminum$()

pages.title: Chromium
pages.text: Suitable materials for alloying with chromium include: $(li)$(l:24_chromium)Chromium$()

pages.title: Gold
pages.text: Suitable materials for alloying with gold include: $(li)$(l:79_gold)Gold$()

pages.title: Silver
pages.text: Suitable materials for alloying with silver include: $(li)$(l:47_silver)Silver$()

pages.title: Nickel
pages.text: Suitable materials for alloying with nickel include: $(li)$(l:28_nickel)Nickel$()

pages.title: Zinc
pages.text: Suitable materials for alloying with zinc include: $(li)$(l:30_zinc)Zinc$()

pages.title: Magnesium
pages.text: Suitable materials for alloying with magnesium include: $(li)$(l:12_magnesium)Magnesium$()
